climbs.name: Dust Bowl Dance
climbs.fa: Mitch Yaggie, Marilla Yaggie, and Roy Suggett

content.description: This line starts free with hands and then after 20 feet disintegrates into off-width clean aid.  It may go free around 12d with all the fat gear needed.  Wear eye protection and socks.  No chalk required.  Just the will and stamina to reach this impressive summit.
content.protection:
Passive = A full set of tricams

Active = BD .4 X 3, #s 1. X 2, 2. X 2, 3. X 2, 4. X 5, 5. X 2, (old) 5. X 1, and # 4 Big Bros X 2.  Valley Giants would help.

Anchor = Three bolts with webbing and a quicklink

Rope = One 60m and a tag line

After reaching the summit work your way around the hump just opposite your exit where you will find sufficient rock, crack, friction, and gravity working on your mass to establish a trad anchor equalized with a cordelette for the second.  Then, after the summit "party", work your way north to the edge of the south summit near the "notch" where the rap anchor is located in the best rock available. Rap here off the east side only a min. from your staging area.
content.location: The route is on the southeast corner of the south summit of Gun-Sight Butte

content.description:
This is another line up the south summit of Gun-Sight Butte, with just a touch of aid at the beginning to get into the main crack system.

The line starts with a poor #1 pecker placement in a shallow seam.  A slightly better beak placement leads to good cams and the start of the free climbing.  The majority of the climb is dirty, but fun squeeze climbing to a soft top out.
content.protection: 1 or 2 small beaks, a single set of cams from fingers to #6 camalots.  I had a #9 valley giant with me and used it, but it's not mandatory.
content.location: The line is the northern most wide crack on the west face of the butte.
